page.title: 06BISHOP BURTON GAS CONNECTION
page.content: Research was undertaken to ascertain whether the village was viable for the {installation of natural gas by NEGAS. There was a high demand for the utility by the residents and further investigation by the company confirmed the viability of the venture. Other nearby villages would also have welcomed gas connection but plans were found to be not feasible. Bishop Burton residents were canvassed individually, with 25% initially enthusiastic. But by November 1985 95% of households had been connected to mains gas (needing 1400 metres of pipe and costing Â£370 per household). And nearly all of these people now have fitted gas appliances in their homes. Gas was not installed in council houses or at the Agricultural college. Despite this the project was deemed successful by all involved.
